name: plenteous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
large in amount, or available in large amounts: The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few. When a man comes to tears, constant tears, plenteous tears, he is in earnest indeed. Synonym
plentiful
More examplesFewer examplesTo my mind, the meal was astonishingly plenteous.In the beginning was television, then there was satellite and now there is cable and behold there are programmes throughout the land and there is plenteous choice.People were trying to stop their eyeballs standing out on stalks, so plenteous were the glittering celebs.
